text: Smarsh is the global leader
in communications intelligence.

The largest financial
institutions in the world
require us to have a homogenous platform
that can work anywhere in the globe.
And by leveraging a partner like AWS,

it's allowed us to provide
that type of solution

that is the same, and has
the same capabilities,
while still being respectful and compliant

of the local data and
government regulations
in the local countries.
We use all the various AWS services,

you know, the basic ones,
Compute for EC2, we use S3.
We use KMS, we use Aurora.

And now we're exploring
some of the other ones
that are available, such as OpenSearch,

such as Neptune for the
knowledge graph capabilities,

using looking at Keyspace
for managed Cassandra.
What AWS means for us is

that we're always going
to be cutting edge,
state of the art.

We minimize our tech
debt as we move forward,

and we can be a scalable
solution for years to come.
Clients and customers

are really looking for a
secure comfort in this space.

The partnership that AWS and
Smarsh bring to the table
gives them that comfort,

gives them that pedigree
and that credibility
that I think they're looking for.

And then finally, it's the
innovation that AWS provides.

Taking advantage of the
out of the box services
allows us to reduce our time to market,

and how quickly we can bring
functionality to the table.
